doc.name: HttpPut
doc.description: Take the input string, wrap it into a HTTP message, and send it to the server associated with the given URL.
doc.author: Edward A. Lee and Marten Lohstroh
doc.port: The input port, which accepts a string that must be formatted and encoded in accordance with the given content-type.

An output port for transmitting a token containing the status of the request. This is a RecordToken comprised of the response code, response message, a boolean indicating if the request was successful, and a boolean indicating if further action is expected.
The output port, which delivers a string, the response to the post.
doc.property: The content-type to go along with the request. This is a string that defaults to "application/x-www-form-urlencoded".
The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection or reading a value. Set to NONE to specify no timeout. This is an integer that defaults to 30000, giving a timeout of 30 seconds.
The response to send upon timeout. If this is empty, then this actor will throw an exception rather than send a response. This is a string that defaults to empty.
The URL to post to. This is a string that defaults to "http://localhost", which refers to a web server on the local host.
